question: Diplotene and zygotene stages are seen in -
exp: Ans. is 'a' i. e., Prophase Meiosiso Meiosis is a process of cell division which is observed only during maturation of sex cells i. e. in final process of gamete formation. o Meiosis consists of tow consecutive divisions, Meiosis 1 and Meiosis II, to yield four haploid gamates from a single diploid grand parent cells. o Hence, the meiosis is called heterotypical or reduction division. o The characteristic of meiosis is that there is no DMA replication between meiosis I and meiosis II. Meiosis Io Meiosis I is divided into following phases. Prophase I: It is further divided into following stages. Leptotene. Zygotene. Pachytene. Diplotene. Diakinesis. Metaphase IAnaphase ITelophase IMeiosis IIo It is divided into following phases1) Prophase II1) Metaphase II1) Anaphase II1) Telophase II

question: Which is not a stage of prophase -
exp: Ans. is 'd' i. e., Arachytene Meiosiso Meiosis is a process of cell division which is observed only during maturation of sex cells i. e. in final process of gamete formation. o Meiosis consists of tow consecutive divisions, Meiosis I and Meiosis II, to yield four haploid gamates from a single diploid grand parent cells. o Hence, the meiosis is called heterotypical or reduction division. o The characteristic of meiosis is that there is no DNA replication between meiosis I and meiosis II. Meiosis Io Meiosis I is divided into following phases1) Prophase I: It is further divided into following stages:-i) Leptoteneii) Zygoteneiii) Pachyteneiv) Diplotenev) Diakinesis2) Metaphase I3) Anaphase I4) Telophase 1. Meiosis IIo It is divided into following phases:-1) Prophase II2) Metaphase II3) Anaphase II4) Telophase II
